adrFormatAddress: 401 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10037-3513, USA

originalText.text: The opening times appear to be just illustrative, good luck finding this place open when they should be. On Saturdays they open when they want, and for sure not at 9am as per their published schedule. Never had issues with the cleaning quality, but they are too unreliable, I cannot be chasing them and go 3 times hoping to be able to pick up my stuff.

originalText.text: Do yourself a huge favor and DO NOT GO HERE!! Especially if your items are pricey luxury clothing brands. They "lost" thousands of dollars worth of my winter coats - about 6 coats in all - including a Canada Goose and a Moncler down. They initially acted as if they had misplaced the items and asked me to come back - three times! On my final attempt to collect the items,  they actually accused me of having returned the day after I originally dropped everything off. They claimed I told them I "couldn't afford" the dry cleaning bill and took my belongings back with me. And yet there I was standing in their store 2 months later trying to pick them up again. Makes sense, right? I was furious! I contacted the owner, who works from their second location in Harlem. He was completely useless and dodged my calls for months. I looked into legal recourse and discovered customers in my predicament are basically hosed in NY state. There is small claims court but a judge isn't interested in the retail price of a name brand item like a Moncler. A coat is a coat is their eyes so you'll never recover the amount you paid. All I can do now is prevent others from having this awful experience. If you're reading this, you have been warned!

originalText.text: Over priced. Couldn't deliver my clothes at the specified time. Couldn't take payment over the phone but "could" at establishment. Broke my cart and the wash and fold was barely folded. Not recommended.
